chunks.content: (一年级起点) 四 年 级 下册 主 编： 范文芳 副主编： 宗 燕 Faridah Pawan 责任编辑 ： 宗 燕 美术设计 ： 陈晓东 马范如 责任印制 ： 出版发行 ： 清华大学出版社 地 址 ： 北京清华大学学研大厦A座 http://www.tup.com.cn 邮 编 ： 100084 社 总 机 ： 010-62770175 邮 购 ： 010-62786544 投稿与读者服务 ： 010-62776969 ， c-service@tup.tsinghua.edu.cn 质 量 反 馈 ： 010-62772015 ， zhiliang@tup.tsinghua.edu.cn 印 刷 者 ： 清华大学印刷厂 经 销 ： 全国新华书店 开 本 ： 185 × 260 印 张 ： 5 版 次 ： 2012年6月第1版 印 次 ： 2012年6月第1次印刷 印 数 ： 定 价 ： 本书如存在文字不清 、 漏印 、 缺页 、 倒页 、 脱页等印装质量问题 ， 请与清华大学出版社出版部联系 调换 。 联系电话 ：（ 010 ） 62770177 转3103 产品编号 ： 040299 本书封面贴有清华大学出版社防伪标签，无标签者不得销售。 版权所有，侵权必究。侵权举报电话： 010-62782989 13701121933 产品编号 ： 040305-01 责任编辑： 宗 燕 责任校对： 李 梅 责任印制： 出版发行： 清华大学出版社 网 址： http://www.tup.com.cn ， http://www.wqbook.com 地 址： 北京清华大学学研大厦A座 邮 编 ： 100084 社 总 机： 010-62770175 邮 购 ： 010-62786544 投稿与读者服务： 010-62776969, c-service@tup.tsinghua.edu.cn 质 量 反 馈： 010-62772015, zhiliang@tup.tsinghua.edu.cn 课 件 下 载： http://www.wqbook.com/qhytl/ 印 刷 者： 装 订 者： 经 销： 全国新华书店 开 本： 185mm × 260mm 印 张： 5 版 次： 2014年9月第1版 印 次： 2014年9月第1次印刷 印 数： 定 价： 5.30元 本书封面贴有清华大学出版社防伪标签，无标签者不得销售。 版权所有，侵权必究。侵权举报电话：010-62782989 13701121933 图书在版编目（CIP）数据 英语. 四年级. 下册 / 范文芳主编. － 北京 : 清华大学出版社, 2014 一年级起点 ISBN 978-7-302-35452-9 I. ①英 ... II. ①范 ... III. ①英语课 － 小学 － 教材 IV. ①G624.311 中国版本图书馆CIP数据核字(2014)第023062号 同学们 ， 欢迎你们使用由清华大学大 、 中 、 小学一条龙英语教学研究 与实践项目组编写的 《 英语 》 课本 ！ 我们为什么要学习英语呢 ？ 你们肯定知道 ， 这是因为英语很重要 。 英语像汉语一样 ， 能够描述丰富多 彩的世界 ， 表达各种各样的思想 。 通过英语 ， 我们可以更多地了解奇妙的世界 ， 了解世界上更多的人 ， 同时也可以把中国介绍给世界上更多的人 ， 让世界上更多 的人了解我们的祖国 ， 了解我们自己 。 在 世纪全球化的国际舞台上 ， 英语已经成为国际交流中的一种重要工 具 ， 因此 ， 我们都要学好英语 。 但是 ， 学好一门语言却不是一朝一夕的事情 ， 而 是需要多年的努力 。 你们年纪小 ， 模仿力强 ， 记忆力好 ， 正是学习英语的最佳时 期 。 希望你们努力学好英语 ， 为长大成材打下基础 。 我们要学习英语还有另外一个原因 ， 那就是英语非常有趣 ！ 英语可以像积 木 、 玩具汽车 、 布娃娃 、 拼图 、 动画片一样 ， 给我们带来无穷的乐趣 ！ 翻开清华大学大 、 中 、 小学一条龙英语教学研究与实践项目组为你们 编写的这套 《 英语 》 课本 ， 你们肯定会被那令人赏心悦目的图画所吸引 ； 听听课 文录音 ， 你们也一定会喜欢那纯正的英语和优美的歌曲

metadata.source: 四年级下册英语清华版电子课本.pdf

chunks.content: 。 在 世纪全球化的国际舞台上 ， 英语已经成为国际交流中的一种重要工 具 ， 因此 ， 我们都要学好英语 。 但是 ， 学好一门语言却不是一朝一夕的事情 ， 而 是需要多年的努力 。 你们年纪小 ， 模仿力强 ， 记忆力好 ， 正是学习英语的最佳时 期 。 希望你们努力学好英语 ， 为长大成材打下基础 。 我们要学习英语还有另外一个原因 ， 那就是英语非常有趣 ！ 英语可以像积 木 、 玩具汽车 、 布娃娃 、 拼图 、 动画片一样 ， 给我们带来无穷的乐趣 ！ 翻开清华大学大 、 中 、 小学一条龙英语教学研究与实践项目组为你们 编写的这套 《 英语 》 课本 ， 你们肯定会被那令人赏心悦目的图画所吸引 ； 听听课 文录音 ， 你们也一定会喜欢那纯正的英语和优美的歌曲 。 责任编辑 ： 宗 燕 美术设计 ： 陈晓东 马范如 责任印制 ： 出版发行 ： 清华大学出版社地 址 ： 北京清华大学学研大厦座 邮 编 ： 社 总 机 ： 邮 购 ： 投稿与读者服务 ：， 质 量 反 馈 ：， 印刷者 ： 清华大学印刷厂 经 销 ： 全国新华书店 开 本 ： 印 张 ： 版 次 ： 年 月第 版 印 次 ： 年 月第 次印刷 印 数 ： 定 价 ： ——致同学 同学们 ， 欢迎你们使用由清华大学 “ 大 、 中 、 小学一条龙英语教学 ” 研究 与实践项目组编写的 《 英语 》 课本 ！ 我们为什么要学习英语呢 ？ 你们肯定知道 ， 这是因为英语很重要 。 英语像汉语一样 ， 能够描述丰富多 彩的世界 ， 表达各种各样的思想 。 通过英语 ， 我们可以更多地了解奇妙的世界 ， 了解世界上更多的人 ， 同时也可以把中国介绍给世界上更多的人 ， 让世界上更多 的人了解我们的祖国 ， 了解我们自己 。 在21世纪全球化的国际舞台上 ， 英语已经成为国际交流中的一种重要工 具 ， 因此 ， 我们都要学好英语 。 但是 ， 学好一门语言却不是一朝一夕的事情 ， 而 是需要多年的努力 。 你们年纪小 ， 模仿力强 ， 记忆力好 ， 正是学习英语的最佳时 期 。 希望你们努力学好英语 ， 为长大成材打下基础 。 我们要学习英语还有另外一个原因 ， 那就是英语非常有趣 ！ 英语可以像积 木 、 玩具汽车 、 布娃娃 、 拼图 、 动画片一样 ， 给我们带来无穷的乐趣 ！ 翻开清华大学 “ 大 、 中 、 小学一条龙英语教学 ” 研究与实践项目组为你们 编写的这套 《 英语 》 课本 ， 你们肯定会被那令人赏心悦目的图画所吸引 ； 听听课 文录音 ， 你们也一定会喜欢那纯正的英语和优美的歌曲 。 这套教材以你们感兴趣的话题为中心 ， 选取的是与你们日常生活息息相关 的内容 。 教材中安排了你们喜欢的动物 、 食物以及你们喜欢的活动如游泳 、 踢 足球等 ， 还有许多生动有趣的故事 ， 相信你们会喜欢这套教材 。 在老师的指导 下 ， 在听 、 说 、 唱 、 动 、 读 、 写中学会用英语说自己想说的话 ， 写出自己的 心声

chunks.content: 。 英语很重要 ！ 英语很有趣 ！ 让我们共同努力 ， 把英语学好

chunks.content: ！ 作者 于清华园 2012年12月 UNIT 1 HOME SWEET HOME ............... 1 UNIT 2 GOING SOMEWHERE .............. 17 UNIT 3 WHEN I GROW UP .................. 33 UNIT 4 SEASONS AND MONTHS OF THE YEAR ...................... 49 FUN READING WHO IS THE STRONGEST? ...... 65 VOCABULARY ...................... 73 Where do we live? Where do animals live? We all live on the Earth. The Earth is home to all of us! UNIT1 HOME SWEET HOME 1 UNIT 1 1. Work in groups. The tree is home to birds and monkeys. Let’s take care of the tree. Who lives in the tree? Birds and monkeys live in the tree. The forest is home to bears and deer. Let’s take care of the forest. Who lives in the forest? Bears and deer live in the forest. 2 2. Listen, look and say. 3. Look at the pictures. Finish the sentences with the correct words. forest (2) pink, white, f lowers Some trees have ________ in spring. Pear trees have ________ f lowers. Peach trees have ________ f lowers. (3) fruit, food, nuts Trees give us ________. Some trees give us _________. Some trees give us _________. (1) autumn, leaves, green Many trees have ________. The leaves are ________ in spring. They are red, yellow and brown in ________. home 3 UNIT 1 1. Work in groups. Who lives in the river? Fish and crocodiles live in the river. Who lives in the ocean? Whales and sharks live in the ocean. The river is home to f ish and crocodiles. Let’s keep the river clean. The ocean is home to whales and sharks. Let’s keep the ocean clean. 4 2. Listen, look and say. crocodilesharkwhaleocean 3. Use the words in the ( ) to answer the question. 4. Listen to the text. Write T or F after each sentence. (1) Who lives in Shanghai? (My grandma) Sharks are f ish. They live in the ocean. Sharks are different from other animals. They do not eat every day. They eat every two or three days! Do you know how sharks sleep? They sleep when they are swimming ! (2) Who will take care of your pet dogs when you go to Shanghai? (My mother) (1) Sharks eat every day

chunks.content: . Write T or F after each sentence. (1) Who lives in Shanghai? (My grandma) Sharks are f ish. They live in the ocean. Sharks are different from other animals. They do not eat every day. They eat every two or three days! Do you know how sharks sleep? They sleep when they are swimming ! (2) Who will take care of your pet dogs when you go to Shanghai? (My mother) (1) Sharks eat every day. (2) Sharks do not sleep. 5 UNIT 1 1. Work in groups. Who lives in the pond? Ducks and frogs live in the pond. Who eats worms? Who eats insects? Ducks eat worms. Frogs eat insects. The pond is home to ducks and frogs. Let’s keep the pond clean. 6 2. Listen, look and say. insectswormduckfrog 3. Write the name of each place under the correct picture. 4. Write the name of each animal under the correct picture. ocean river lake pond duck f ish shark crocodile insects frog whale butterf ly ____________________________________________ ____________________________________________ ____________________________________________ 7 UNIT 1 1. Work in groups. Who lives in the grassland? Lions and giraffes live in the grassland. Who lives in the jungle? Tigers and elephants live in the jungle. The jungle is home to tigers and elephants. Let’s take care of the jungle. UNIT 1 The grassland is home to lions and giraffes. Let’s take care of the grassland. 8 2. Listen, look and say. tiger liongiraffeelephant 3. Look at the picture. Read the sentence. Tick the correct picture and word. Write the word on the line. (1) A _______ is big. (f ish, whale) (2) A _______ is strong. (lion, monkey) (3) A _______ is a big f ish. (f rog, shark) (4) An _______ has six legs. (elephant, insect) (5) Butterf lies are _______. (birds, insects) 9 UNIT 1 1. Work in groups. Who lives in the countryside? Farmers live in the countryside. Farmers grow crops in the countryside. Who lives in the city? Workers, doctors and teachers live in the city. The city is home to workers, doctors and teachers. Many of us live in the city, too

chunks.content: . (f rog, shark) (4) An _______ has six legs. (elephant, insect) (5) Butterf lies are _______. (birds, insects) 9 UNIT 1 1. Work in groups. Who lives in the countryside? Farmers live in the countryside. Farmers grow crops in the countryside. Who lives in the city? Workers, doctors and teachers live in the city. The city is home to workers, doctors and teachers. Many of us live in the city, too. Let’s keep the city clean. The countryside is home to farmers and crops. Let’s take care of the countryside. 10 2. Listen, look and say. 3. Finish the sentences with the words from the word box. the cityfarmercrops city Workers countryside crops doctor school (4) Beijing is a big ________. Shanghai is a big city, too. _______ live in the city. (1) Farmers live in the ___________. They grow _______ in the fields. (2) My father is a _______. My mother is a teacher. (3) I am a student in a big __________. There are 85 teachers in my school. the countryside 11 UNIT 1 1. Work in groups. Who lives on the Earth? People, animals and plants live on the Earth. Who needs air? People, animals and plants need air. The Earth is home to all of us. Let’s take care of the Earth. Air is important to all of us. Let’s keep the air clean. 12 2. Listen, look and say. 3. Read about the food chain. Then draw a picture to finish each food chain. Write the name of the picture on the line. peopleanimalsthe Earthplantsair Animals eat to live. Some animals eat plants. Some animals eat other animals. For example, grass grows. Rabbits eat the grass. Foxes eat the rabbits. nutsmouse ___________ grass rabbitfox ___________ carrotspig ___________ 13 UNIT 1 1. Listen, look and say. Fill in the missing letters. __i__ycountrys__d__wor__ __ ____ar__er the Ear__ ____ __r __or____ __sects __cea____ __arkwh__l__c__ __co__ __le __rass__andjun__ __ __gi__ __ffe__ __er 工人 14 Bears and deer live in the forest. Let’s take care of the forest. 2. Circle the word in each group that does not belong. 3

Fill in the missing letters. __i__ycountrys__d__wor__ __ ____ar__er the Ear__ ____ __r __or____ __sects __cea____ __arkwh__l__c__ __co__ __le __rass__andjun__ __ __gi__ __ffe__ __er 工人 14 Bears and deer live in the forest. Let’s take care of the forest. 2. Circle the word in each group that does not belong. 3. Write two sentences to tell about each picture. The first one is done for you. (1) animals plants people the Earth (2) giraffe forest jungle grassland (3) lion insect tiger giraffe (4) whale shark worm crocodile (5) farmer worker countryside teacher (6) river city ocean pond _______________________________ _______________________________ (2) whales and sharks, ocean _______________________________ _______________________________ (3) people, animals and plants, the Earth _____________________________ _________________________ (1) bears and deer, forest 15 UNIT 2 1616 Everyone may lose their way. You may, too. Do you know how to ask for and Give directions? Let’s see... UNIT2 GOING SOMEWHERE 17 UNIT 2 1. Listen, look and say. 2. Act it out. bookstore streetright Go down this street for five minutes. The bookstore is on the right. Can you tell me how to get to the bookstore? Tom wants to go to the bookstore, but he cannot f ind it. 18 3. Fun with words. 4. Draw a line from the sentence to the picture that tells about it. (1) Find a short word in the longer word. Write it on the line. street welcome bookstore minute (2) Change one letter to make a new word. Write it on the line. but go right bell kind (1) There is a big bookstore on Apple Street. (2) Please ride on the right side of the street. (3) I use my right hand to draw. (4) The park is on the right side of the river. 19 UNIT 2 1. Listen, look and say. library 图书馆 left 2. Act it out. Can you tell me how to get to the library? Go down this street for 100 meters. The library is on the left. Tom wants to go to the library, but he cannot f ind it. 20 3. Listen to the story

chunks.content: . (2) Please ride on the right side of the street. (3) I use my right hand to draw. (4) The park is on the right side of the river. 19 UNIT 2 1. Listen, look and say. library 图书馆 left 2. Act it out. Can you tell me how to get to the library? Go down this street for 100 meters. The library is on the left. Tom wants to go to the library, but he cannot f ind it. 20 3. Listen to the story. Then tick the correct answer. My grandpa is in the garden. A man comes to him and asks, “I’m going to walk to the library. Can you tell me how much time I need?” “No,” says my grandpa. The man walks away. My grandpa looks at him for one minute. Then he says, “Come back, please.” The man comes back. He asks, “Why?” “I need to know how fast you walk,” says my grandpa. “You walk 80 meters in one minute. You need 20 minutes to walk to the library.” (1) My grandpa is _______. A. at home B. in the garden C. in the street (2) It is __________ meters from the garden to the library. A. 400 B. 1000 C. 1600 21 UNIT 2 1. Listen, look and say. bus stoptraffic lightscorner 2. Act it out. Go straight. Turn right when you get to the traffic lights. The bus stop is not far from the corner. Can you tell me the way to the bus stop? Tom comes out of the library. He is going home. He needs to take a bus f irst, but he cannot f ind the bus stop. 22 3. Follow the directions. (1) Draw a line to match the opposites. come yes new boy left right girl go no old (2) Change one letter to make a new word. Write it on the line. see bus take home day (3) Circle the word which does not have the long i sound. library f ind of f icer right light 4. Read the story. Write the number under each picture to show the correct order of the story. (1) Jane is going to take a bus. It begins to rain. (2) Jane sees a small shop at the corner of the street. She is going to buy an umbrella there. (3) Jane buys an umbrella. She is walking out of the shop. (4) Jane is waiting for the bus at the bus stop. SHOP SHOP 23 UNIT 2 1

chunks.content: . Read the story. Write the number under each picture to show the correct order of the story. (1) Jane is going to take a bus. It begins to rain. (2) Jane sees a small shop at the corner of the street. She is going to buy an umbrella there. (3) Jane buys an umbrella. She is walking out of the shop. (4) Jane is waiting for the bus at the bus stop. SHOP SHOP 23 UNIT 2 1. Listen, look and say. subwaypost office 2. Act it out. Go straight. Turn left at the second traffic lights. The subway is beside the post office. Can you tell me the way to the subway? Tom gets off the bus. He needs to take the subway now, but he cannot f ind it. 24 3. Look at the picture. Finish the sentence with the words from the word box. (5) ______________ to the traf f ic lights. Then ___________. (1) ___________ the street for 60 meters. Then ___________. (2) ___________ are red, yellow and green. (3) I _____________ home after school every day. (4) There is a post of f ice ______ the bookstore. go straight go down turn left traf f ic lights beside take the subway turn right 坐地铁 25 UNIT 2 1. Listen, look and say. supermarketcinema 2. Act it out. Yes, there is. Go straight and turn left at the first corner. The supermarket is beside the cinema. Is there a supermarket near here? Tom is hungry. He wants to buy some snacks, but he cannot f ind a supermarket. 26 We buy vegetables in the supermarket. 4. Match the question to its answer. I walk to school. Is there a school near here? Yes, there is.Where do you buy food? Where do you live? How do you go to school?In the supermarket. vegetables fruitclothes 3. Listen and number. supermarketlibrarycinemapost office 5. Ask and answer. Where do you buy vegetables? I live near my school. 27 UNIT 2 1. Listen, look and say. toiletbank 2. Act it out. Yes, there is. Turn right at the corner. There is a toilet beside the bank. Is there a toilet near here? Tom needs to use the toilet, but he cannot find one. 28 3. Fun with words

Listen, look and say. toiletbank 2. Act it out. Yes, there is. Turn right at the corner. There is a toilet beside the bank. Is there a toilet near here? Tom needs to use the toilet, but he cannot find one. 28 3. Fun with words. (2) Find a short word in the longer word. Write it on the line. beside corner subway near bookstore (1) Circle the pair of words whose red letters have the same sound. bus subway yes get bank cake Tom boat supermarket use need street m inute light cinema corner toilet boy 4. Ask and answer. Yes. Turn right at the corner. The cinema is beside the bookstore. Is there a cinema near here? banktoiletcinemasupermarket 29 UNIT 2 1. Listen, look and say. Fill in the missing letters. __ __braryc__n__m__b__ __kst__ __e t__ __le__cor__ __ __sub__ __ __ __ __ __k__ __st off ice__ _per__ __ __ket 30 2. Look at the picture. Use the words to answer the question. The first one is done for you. (2) turn right, not far from the corner Lily: Can you tell me how to get to the supermarket? Tom: (1) go straight, on the right Jane: Can you tell me how to get to the bank? Tom: Go straight. The bank is on the right. Peter: Can you tell me the way to the library? Tom: (4) go straight for five minutes, beside the cinema Sam: Is there a toilet near here? Tom: (3) go straight and turn left, on the left 31 UNIT 3 WHEN I GROW UP... What does your father do? What does your mother do? What do you want to be When you grow up? 32 UNIT3 WHEN I GROW UP... 33 UNIT 3 1. Work in pairs. I want to be a doctor or a nurse. I want to work in the hospital. What do doctors or nurses do? What do you want to be when you grow up? Nurses take your temperature. Doctors listen to your heart. Doctors give you medicine. Nurses give you a shot. 34 2. Listen, look and say. 3. Let’s play! My baby is well now. Thank you

metadata.source: 四年级下册英语清华版电子课本.pdf

chunks.content: ... 33 UNIT 3 1. Work in pairs. I want to be a doctor or a nurse. I want to work in the hospital. What do doctors or nurses do? What do you want to be when you grow up? Nurses take your temperature. Doctors listen to your heart. Doctors give you medicine. Nurses give you a shot. 34 2. Listen, look and say. 3. Let’s play! My baby is well now. Thank you. temperatureheartshotmedicine My baby is ill. What can I do? I’ll take her temperature. I’ll listen to her heart. I’ll give her a shot. I’ll give her some medicine. 35 UNIT 3 What do firefighters do? 1. Work in pairs. I want to be a firefighter. I like the firefighter uniform. What do you want to be when you grow up? Firefighters put out f ires. Firefighters save people from danger. 36 3. Look at the picture. Finish the sentence with the correct word from the word box. 2. Listen, look and say. firefirefighter firefighter uniform (1) The child is in _________. She is yelling for help. (2) A frog is coming to eat the butterfly. Who will _________ it from danger? (3) Firefighters wear uniforms. They _________ out fires. (4) I like my school_________ . I wear it to school. save danger uniform put 37 UNIT 3 What do police officers do? 1. Work in pairs. chunks.content: . What do farmers do? I want to be a farmer. I like the fields and farm animals. I like to live on the farm. What do you want to be when you grow up? 1. Work in pairs. Farmers raise animals. 40 2. Listen, look and say. 3. Listen to the text. Then find a sentence in the text that tells about each picture. Write it under its picture. farmfarmercropsfields ฀฀ ฀฀ ฀฀ Farmers raise animals on the farm. Much of our food comes from farm animals. Farmers raise pigs for their meat. Farmers raise chickens and ducks for their eggs. Meat and eggs are important food. Farmers raise cows for their milk. We drink milk. We make cheese and yogurt from milk. ______________ ______________ ______________ ______________ ______________ ______________ ______________ ______________ ______________ 41 UNIT 3 What teacher do you want to be? 1. Four seasons make a year. Year in, year out. We live in a changing world. 48 UNIT4 SEASONS AND MONTHS OF THE YEAR 49 UNIT 4 1. Talk about the four seasons. There are four seasons in a year. They are spring, summer, autumn and winter. springsummer autumnwinter Four seasons make a year. 50 2. Talk about the months. There are twelve months in a year. Here are the names of the months: Twelve months make a year. JanuaryFebruaryMarchApril MayJuneJulyAugust September October November December 51 UNIT 4 1. Act it out. 2. Listen to the story. Then answer the questions. My name is Autumn. My name is Winter. My name is Spring.My name is Summer. I’m the King. My name is Year

chunks.content: . 50 2. Talk about the months. There are twelve months in a year. Here are the names of the months: Twelve months make a year. JanuaryFebruaryMarchApril MayJuneJulyAugust September October November December 51 UNIT 4 1. Act it out. 2. Listen to the story. Then answer the questions. My name is Autumn. My name is Winter. My name is Spring.My name is Summer. I’m the King. My name is Year. I have four sons. They are Spring, Summer, Autumn and Winter. The king asked, “What will you do if you become the new king?” Spring said, “I’ll plant seeds.” Summer said, “I’ll water the crops and make them grow.” Autumn said, “I’ll cut the crops and carry them home.” Winter said, “I’ll store the crops.” 52 3. Look at the pictures. Finish the sentences. The king was very happy. He said, “You all have good ideas. You’ll take turns to be king. Spring will be king in March, April and May. Summer will be king in June, July and August. Autumn will be king in September, October and November. Winter will be king in December, January and February.” (1) People ___________ in spring. (2) People ___________ and make them grow in summer. (3) People ___________ and carry them home in autumn. (4) People ___________ the crops in winter. (1) What was the name of the king? __________________________ (2) What were the names of his four sons? ______________________________ Read it. ask — asked say — said is — was 53 UNIT 4 1. Act it out. How many days are there in a year? There are 365 or 366 days in a year. Some months have 31 days. These months are: January, March, May, July, August, October and December. Some months have 30 days. These months are: April, June, September and November. February has 28 or 29 days. How many days are there in a month? How many days are there in a month? 54 3. Write the name of the month that answers the question. 2. Learn it: The vowel letter o can sound like the o in coat, box or sport. Read the sound at the beginning of each group

chunks.content: . Some months have 30 days. These months are: April, June, September and November. February has 28 or 29 days. How many days are there in a month? How many days are there in a month? 54 3. Write the name of the month that answers the question. 2. Learn it: The vowel letter o can sound like the o in coat, box or sport. Read the sound at the beginning of each group. Circle the word in each row whose red letter does not make that sound. (1) New Year’s Day is in the first month. What month is it? (2) Teacher’s Day is in the month after August. What month is it? (3) Christmas is in the month after November. What month is it? 4. Let’s say it! Our Chinese New Year is in January or February. 56 Jan. 1 firstsecondthird sixthfourthfifth Mar. 8May 12Dec. 25 2. Listen, look and say. 3. Let’s say it! 4. Read the question. When is your birthday? _____________________ 2013 57 UNIT 4 1. Talk about it. Spring is the season between winter and summer. It is the beginning of the year. Summer is the season between spring and autumn. Summer days are long and hot. It is April. It is spring. I wear a shirt, trousers and spring shoes. It is July. It is summer. I wear a T-shirt and shorts. 58 2. Look at the pictures. Finish the sentences. 3. Write a sentence to tell about each picture. The first one is done for you. (1) There are three months in spring. They are ___________________. (2) There are three months in summer. They are _____________________

It is the best season to get pumpkins. Winter is the season between autumn and spring. Winter nights are long and cold. It is October. It is autumn. I wear a sweater, trousers and sports shoes. It is December. It is winter. I wear a hat, a scarf and warm clothes. 60 2. Answer the question. (1) There are three months in autumn. They are ____________________. (1) Farmers take care of the crops in the day. (2) (3) (2) There are three months in winter. They are ___________________. (3) What is the name of the tenth month? It is _________________________. 3. Look at the picture. Write a sentence to tell whether the activity happens in the day or at night. The first one is done for you. 61 UNIT 4 1. Listen, look and say. Fill in the missing letters. __ __nu__ry __ __ __ru__ry Mar__ ____ __ril __ __y__ __ne__ __lyAu__ __ __ __ __ __ __tember__ __tober __ __vember De__ __ __ber 62 2. Listen to the sentences. I wear a T-shirt and a skirt. I go swimming. (2) October, a sweater and trousers, pick apples (3) January, warm clothes, go skating (1) There are ________ months in a year. chunks.content: . Fill in the missing words. 3. Write some sentences to tell about each picture. The first one is done for you. (1) August, a T-shirt and a skirt, go swimming It’s August. It’s summer. I wear a T-shirt and a skirt. I go swimming. (2) October, a sweater and trousers, pick apples (3) January, warm clothes, go skating (1) There are ________ months in a year. Twelve ________ make a year. There are ________ seasons in a year. Four ________ make a year. There are ________ months in a season. Three ________ make a season. (2) There are ________ hours in a day. There are ________ minutes in an hour. 63 Strong, stronger, strongest! Who is the strongest in the world? Is it you? Or is it me? That is the question! 64 FUN READING WHO IS THE STRONGEST? 65 The sun shone and shone. The man was very hot. He took off his coat. I think the sun is the strongest. He can shine over the world. Who is the strongest in the world? I am the strongest in the world. Look at that man. I can make him take off his coat. All the mice, except the second one, sang and danced. The four mice were happy that they found the answer. The strongest, the strongest! The sun is the strongest in the world. 66 I think the cloud is the strongest. He can cover up the sun. I am the strongest. Look at the sun. I can cover it up. The second mouse did not agree. The cloud moved and moved. The sun became smaller and smaller. At last, the mice could not see the sun. What a surprise! The cloud is stronger than the sun! All the mice, except the third one, sang and danced. The four mice were happy that they found the answer. The strongest, the strongest! The cloud is the strongest in the world. 67 I think the wind is the strongest. He can blow the cloud away. The strongest, the strongest! The wind is the strongest in the world. I am the strongest. Look at the cloud. I can blow it away. The third mouse did not agree. The wind blew and blew. The cloud became smaller and smaller. At last, there was no cloud left

metadata.source: 四年级下册英语清华版电子课本.pdf

chunks.content: . The strongest, the strongest! The cloud is the strongest in the world. 67 I think the wind is the strongest. He can blow the cloud away. The strongest, the strongest! The wind is the strongest in the world. I am the strongest. Look at the cloud. I can blow it away. The third mouse did not agree. The wind blew and blew. The cloud became smaller and smaller. At last, there was no cloud left. What a surprise! The wind was stronger than the cloud! All the mice, except the fourth one, sang and danced. The four mice were happy that they found the answer. 68 I think the wall is the strongest. He can stop the wind. I am the strongest. Look at the wind. I can stop it. The strongest, the strongest! The wall is the strongest in the world. The four mice were happy that they found the answer. The fourth mouse did not agree. The wind moved and moved. It was very tired, but it still could not pass the wall. The wall stopped the wind. What a surprise! The wall is stronger than the wind! All the mice, except the fifth one, sang and danced. 69 Who is stronger than the wall? Look here, everyone. The fifth mouse did not answer. He went over to the wall. The four mice looked at the wall. What did they see? They saw a big hole in the wall! The fifth mouse did not agree. I do not think the wall is the strongest in the world. 70 What a surprise! The mouse can make a hole in the wall! I am the strongest. Look at the wall. I can make it fall. The mice went into the hole. They saw a big mouse busy working. He was making the hole bigger and bigger. The big mouse worked and worked. The hole became bigger and bigger. At last, the wall fell down. 71 Now I see. The mouse is the strongest in the world! That night, the f ive mice had a big dinner to celebrate. They were happy that, at last, they found the right answer. Just then, a cat came and all the mice ran away

At last, the wall fell down. 71 Now I see. The mouse is the strongest in the world! That night, the f ive mice had a big dinner to celebrate. They were happy that, at last, they found the right answer.
